fields.summary: Disallow users from uploading certain types of files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11731].
  {panel}

It would be really nice to have a possibility to list *recently updated personal spaces*. It is possible to create rss feed listing changed content from personal spaces only, but that isn't usable if one or two users are much more active than others or if there has been many changes recently. Thus, it would be nice to see a list of changed *spaces* making it is easy to see if someone has created new content in one's personal space.

This feature could be included in Recently Updated Macro, and maybe this functionality could be included in browsepeople.action-page, too (some kind of sorting order perhaps). Macro could list the most recent change(s) in a space (configurable amount) and a picture of that space. 

Here is an example of macro showing two recent changes per space:
|| :) Anne's space | List of hobbies | by Anne (04 May) |
|| :) Bob's space | Re: Bob's blog | by Charlie (03 May)  | 
| | Bob's blog | by Bob (03 May)  | 
|| :) Charlie's space | How I... | by Charlie (02 May) |  

This feature is important because it would encourage users to update their personal spaces ([this is important specially for new users|http://www.wikipatterns.com/display/wikipatterns/MySpace]) and make it easier to find other users' personal spaces.

If there already is some way to do this I apologize the fuzz ;)
fields.summary: Possibility to list recently updated personal spaces

fields.description: When editing labels for a page in Confluence Markup, the suggested labels drop down, but the broeser scrolls to the top of the page. When subsequently scrolling down to select a suggested label, the dropdown closes. Usability Catch-22.

fields.description:
If you create a news post, lets say 'abc' and you decide that you want to edit it for capitalization, if you hit edit and change the name to 'Abc' it gives " You can not create two news items on the same day with the same title."

This is not the case in 2.7.1
fields.summary: Titles of news posts cannot be corrected for capitalization
Errors retrieving mail from Microsoft Exchange: "Unable to load BODYSTRUCTURE"

fields.description:
The formatting of the recently-updated macro used at the space level (Browse Space  > List Pages - Recently Updated) is broken when the user has applied a different theme. 
I.e. The behaviour is only normal when using the Default Confluence Theme. 

I've confirmed this is broken in Confluence 2.7.1, however 2.7.2 has this problem fixed.

The symptoms are that the user will see a distorted list of items with heaps of spacing. Refer to screenshots for more information.

If you are experiencing this problem from 2.6.x to 2.7.1, the workaround is to stick to the *Default Confluence Theme* or to upgrade to 2.7.2.
fields.summary: Formatting of Recently-updated macro broken at the space level if not using Default Confluence Theme

I have created a template that contains metadata macros and scaffolding.  Whenever I create a page from this template I can enter a Title and see all of my WIKI code correctly.  However as soon I save it the first time I get an error.  After I discard the error and go back to my space the page was created successfully and I can edit/update any values with out any errors.  This error occurs almost every single time but only for the first time the page is saved.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11634].
  {panel}

I have 2 suggestions related to users and group management in the Administration section of Confluence.

1) Have the number of users displayed when viewing the group members (Administration-->Manage Groups-->Group Members) configurable.  This would essentially be the same functionality that is on the Manage Users screen available through the Show (10, 20, 50, 100) option.  The old version of Confluence we used would display all group members, while 2.8 displays 10 members per page.  Some people like more, some less, so it would be a nice-to-have to be able to select this dynamically.

2) When creating a new group, it would be great to be able to add members in bulk.  Currently I have to create the group, then search for each individual user, edit their groups, and add them to the new group.  It would be more efficient if when the group is created (or alternatively have an option from the Manage Groups-->Group Members screen) to multi-select users to add to the group as a single add operation.

Thanks for considering these enhancements,
Barry Pape
fields.summary: User Groups Enhancements

fields.description:
- The current implementation of group by space is unscalable - it basically repeats the user's search n times, with n being the number of spaces the user has permissions to see. 
- Group by type exhibits the same problem (although potentially less severe than by space), as it performs, at present, 7 searches in the background, one against each of the existing content types. 
- finally, the implementation is fundamentally wrong, as it is not grouping the results, so much as doing x number of searches proportional to number of types or spaces available.
fields.summary: Remove "group by" functionality on search

fields.description:
Feedback:  the Confluence documentation really needs some work, because it's in a pretty superficial state at the moment.   I was trying to setup a new server and migrate away from an old one (which wasn't documented at all by a previous person on my team).  The part where the JDBC connector gets configured has no hints at all to make it work - quite unlike the documentation you have for JIRA.

This is the information for Confluence:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+mySQL

Not only does it have missing parts, it references utilities which require GUIs.  This doesn't show any of the underlying details necessary for performing the same functions on the command-line.  This makes me extremely unhappy as debugging when it doesn't work amounts to trial-and-error.

In contrast, here is the documentation for Jira:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+up+JIRA+Standalone+and+MySQL+on+Linux

I was (pleasantly) surprised to find it so straightforward.
fields.summary: Confluence Documentation for  Database Setup for MySQL needs improvement

fields.description:
We have a problem with getting Confuence to render long urls correctly.

Users would like add a url to this page on their wiki page: http://wikis.sun.com/display/CommSuite/Communications+Suite+6+Component+Products+Release+Notes#CommunicationsSuite6ComponentProductsReleaseNotes-RequirementsforC6

If they insert it as:
{noformat}
[Requirements for Communications Suite 6|Communications Suite 6 Component Products Release Notes#CommunicationsSuite6ComponentProductsReleaseNotes-RequirementsforC6]
{noformat}

The url that Confluence generates looks like this:
http://wikis.sun.com/display/CommSuite/Communications+Suite+6+Component+Products+Release+Notes#CommunicationsSuite6ComponentProductsReleaseNotes-ommunicationsSuite6ComponentProductsReleaseNo...
(the three dots at the end and a missing "C" in the anchor are part of confluence output)

They also tried to use a workaround and insert an absolute link instead, but then they face intermittent problems due to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9392
{noformat}
[_Requirements for Communications Suite 6_ | http://wikis.sun.com/display/CommSuite/Communications+Suite+6+Component+Products+Release+Notes#CommunicationsSuite6ComponentProductsReleaseNotes-RequirementsforC6]
{noformat}

I was able to reproduce the problem on your wiki here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TESTING/Corrupted+URL+Bug
fields.summary: Confluence link macro generates urls with corrupted anchors

fields.description:
I have a document with LaTeX equations in Confluence that I need to export to Word. 

The LaTeX images are not automatically inserted in the Word document.  However, they are placed in the temp folder in order.  So, my original solution was, after export, to individually insert each image in the Word document from the temp folder.

I now have a document close to 200 pages long with more than 1000 LaTeX equations.  I am now trying to insert the LaTeX images (.png) that are created during export into the Confluence page because any .png file should automatically be inserted in a Word document.  

When I export a Confluence page with images of LaTeX equations (instead of actual LaTeX), the quality of the images varies, and not even in a consistent way.  Some images look great, some are shrunk, some are stretched.  And it isn't the same every time I export.  So, I can export the same page numerous times and not know which images will look good and which ones will be altered.

How do I fix this?  It is a very time consuming problem, and I appreciate your help.

Thanks!
Tiffany
fields.summary: Images of LaTeX equations exported to Word are of varying quality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11619].
  {panel}

A few versions ago of Confluence, drafts were moved from being simple objects stored in their own table, to be ContentEntityObjects stored in the Content table.  Rows in the Content table that represent drafts, contain values for draftpageid, draftspacekey, draftpageversion and drafttype.  

They contain NULL for pageid and spaceid.  There seems to be no reason at all that they couldn't use pageid and spaceid instead of their own values. 

I suspect draftpageversion could quite adequately use version, which is always 1 for drafts, but I can see that the columns have slightly different meanings and therefore have a reason for being separate.

drafttype is always the type of the page to which draftpageid refers.  I haven't researched whether there is a good argument for repeating it here or whether it would be just as useful to retrieve it by the reasonably simple join of draftpageid (or if I have my way just pageid) = contentid.
fields.summary: Drafts should be refactored to use existing parts of ContentEntityObject

fields.description:
Confluence 2.7.x contained an index called c_draftspacekey_idx (incompatible with DB2)
Confluence 2.8 contained an index called c_draftspckey_idx

These indexes are not worthwhile and should be removed from old versions by an upgrade task.

This only affects fresh installs or upgrades where the [indexes ddl|http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/4578/indexes.ddl?version=3] was run.
fields.summary: Draft Space Key's index should be removed on upgrade

fields.description:
Not sure if this has already been requested - apologies if it has It would be really cool if you could insert macros whilst creating/editing a page using the RTE.

Just like we have a button to insert a link or an image it would be great if there was a button in the RTE toolbar to insert a macro.

Clicking the button would open the "Insert Macro" window which would have all the available macros sorted by category. You then choose your macro and define its parameters much like the Formula Builder window in Excel. (see screenshot attached)

Once you have selected your macro and defined its parameters the RTE should render the macro for display.

Just an idea....

fields.description:
WHY THIS IS A BUG: Selecting to discard a prior version  of a wiki page should NEVER cause unsaved content in the current browser window to disappear.

HOW TO REPRODUCE: Start to edit a page in Firefox. Don't save it.

Copy and pasted the URL into a new, blank Internet Explorer window. (Make sure you have already logged into Confluence with IE previously, so it starts  out without having to ask for your credentials.)

A message at the top of the page will read "A version of this page you were editing at [date] [time] was not saved. Do you want to resume editing or discard it? "

Ignore the warning message for a while and update the content in IE

Click the discard link in IE. 

The content you typed into IE is now lost.
fields.summary: Current draft deleted when eliminating prior unsaved draft

fields.description:
According to the Webwork / Xwork people, an action without a specified class attribute should use the class ActionSupport from the xwork jar. (See [here|http://wiki.opensymphony.com/display/WW/Action+configuration#Actionconfiguration-ActionSupport])

If the following code is given to confluence in atlassian-plugin.xml then the plugin fails to load stating that a NullPointerException occurred when processing the module descriptor:

{code:xml}
<xwork key="blah" name="blah">
	<description>A broken plugin</description>
	<package name="test-webexport" extends="default" namespace="/plugins/a_plugin">
		<action name="test">
			<interceptor-ref name="defaultStack" />
			<result name="success" type="velocity">/velocity/testpage.vm</result>
		</action>
	</package>
</xwork>
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence does not process some xwork modules which do not specify an Action class

fields.description:
We noticed some discrepancies in the content on our two nodes. When trying to debug the issue, I noticed that the indexing queue on one node contained many items, yet the last time it was flushed was more than 3hours ago.

Current time: 10:26am

node1:
{noformat}
Queue is currently idle 

Queue Last Processed
Started	Apr 24, 2008 10:09
Time taken	7899ms
Tasks processed	85
Index recreated	NO
Index optimized	NO
Queued For Next Processing Run
Number of items in queue: 18 
{noformat}

node2:
{noformat}
Queue is currently idle 

Queue Last Processed
Started	Apr 24, 2008 07:19
Time taken	5693ms
Tasks processed	77
Index recreated	NO
Index optimized	NO

Number of items in queue: 240 
{noformat}

When I manually flushed the queue  (using the link at the bottom of the page), the content issues were resolved.

I checked the logs, but there were no problems related to indexing reported at around the time when the indexing last ran.

The issue however persists even after the manual flush, because the scheduler that is supposed to flush the queues every minute apparently doesn't work (there are 120 new items in the queue and it's been 20 minutes since I flushed it manually).
fields.summary: Index queue not flushed - cluster nodes are out of sync

fields.description:
Confluence prints the following error when starting up:

{noformat}
SEVERE: Exception starting filter jmx
    org.springframework.jmx.export.UnableToRegisterMBeanException: Unable to register MBean
    [com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxSMTPMailServer@199ec67[id=1208645280823,name=SMTP Server,description=<null>,
    server name=<null>,username=confluence@veil.org.ua,password=qwerty,isSessionServer=true,
    defaultFrom=confluence@veil.org.ua,prefix=[confluence],smtpPort=465]] with object name 
    [Confluence:name=MailServer-SMTP Server]; nested exception is javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException:
    Confluence:name=MailServer-SMTP Server
Caused by: javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: Confluence:name=MailServer-SMTP Server
at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.Repository.addMBean(Unknown Source)
at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.internal_addObject(Unknown Source)
at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerDynamicMBean(Unknown Source)
at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerObject(Unknown Source)
at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerMBean(Unknown Source)
at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.JmxMBeanServer.registerMBean(Unknown Source)
at org.springframework.jmx.support.MBeanRegistrationSupport.doRegister(MBeanRegistrationSupport.java:162)
at org.springframework.jmx.export.MBeanExporter.registerManagedResource(MBeanExporter.java:431)
at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.MBeanExporterWithUnregisterImpl.registerManagedResource(MBeanExporterWithUnregisterImpl.java:93)
at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxFilter.registerObject(JmxFilter.java:164)
at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxFilter.doMailServer(JmxFilter.java:87)
at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxFilter.registerBeans(JmxFilter.java:63)
at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxFilter.init(JmxFilter.java:42)
{noformat}

There are two issues to consider here:

1) Why does the MBean already exist? It should not be registered twice during startup.

2) If it does exist, we probably shouldn't stop the entire application from starting up. The existence should be checked before registration and it should recover from this error gracefully.
fields.summary: JMX registration of MailServer can fail if the MBean already exists

fields.description:
The standard 500/server error page displays large amounts of information about the server. While this is very convenient for troubleshooting, it's a problem in environments where security is a major concern and it's important to provide as little information as possible to potential attackers.
We can, and currently have to, ask customers to customise 500page.jsp themselves. However, it should be easy enough for us to include an alternative version which simply shows the following:

CONFLUENCE
System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

Please contact your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. attach the application server log file (if possible). 

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!
fields.summary: Alternative 500page.jsp with minimal information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11553].
  {panel}

"If someone grants anonymous access to a space, then all "registered/non-anonymous/logged-in" users can view that space too. It doesn't make sense if a logged in user to have less permissions than an anonymous user. That means, Confluence only cares that the anonymous "view" permissions have been given to that space and that the logged in user has 'can use' permission."

The WARNING message in the space should be enhanced to further explains the above scenario. Ideally, it should says:

WARNING:  Anonymous users will not be able to view this space, because they have not been granted the global 'Use Confluence' permission. 
You can grant anonymous access to Confluence from global permissions.
*NOTE: logged-in users, if not explicitly granted permission to this space, will receive the 'anonymous' rights below"*

fields.description:
# Install confluence-2.7.3, configure it with "docPath="<YourConfluenceInstallPath>/confluence"".
# Start tomcat5 and browse to your confluence server: http://yourServer/confluence
# Look at the last line on the page. It mentions confluence version 2.7.3.
# Stop tomcat5.
# Change to your confluence install (/opt/confluence-2.7.3) directory.
# Build the war by issuing "./build.sh". If all dependencies are installed this should went fine, leaving "dist/confluence-2.7.3.war" for deployment.
# Change your configuration to use the created "war" instead of the ear: change "docPath" to "docPath="/opt/confluence-2.7.3/dist/confluence-2.7.3.war""
# Start tomcat5.
# Point your browser to http://yourServer/confluence
# Look at the last line on the page. It mentions confluence version 2.7.3.
# Stop tomcat5.
# Unpack confluence-2.8.0.tar.gz into your installation (/opt) directory.
# Copy the one file confluence holds the data-directory path in: "copy confluence-2.7.3/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/confluence-properties.xml confluence-2.8.0/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/" overwriting the existing file.
# Change to confluence-2.8.0
# Build the war issuing "./build.sh". This will run fine, leaving "dist/confluence-2.8.0.war" for deployment.
# Change "docPath="/opt/confluence-2.8.0/dist/confluence-2.8.0.war""
# Start tomcat5.
# Point your browser to your confluence server: http://yourServer/confluence/"
# Look at the last line on the page. It mentions confluence version 2.7.3!

Shouldn't it mention confluence version 2.8.0?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11544].

There are a few layers of abstraction in the Confluence UI that don't provide a lot of benefit. We should clean up some of this stuff:

- remove root.vmd, replace with calls directly to the appropriate decorator
- split global.vmd into several well-defined decorators

May add more stuff as I see it.

fields.description:
The current naming could be improved a bit. It's Diagnosticlog4j.properties and Productionlog4j.properties, which aren't easy to find. Better would be:

- log4j.properties
- log4j-diagnostic.properties
- log4j-production.properties.

It also turns out that the production one is a copy of the default and _isn't actually used_. We should remove it.
fields.summary: Improve log4j files

fields.description:
The latest version of the Confluence Clustered Installation available is a little misleading:

      http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Cluster+Installation

When following the installation steps it is not clear that the server for the second node must also have Java installed. Currently it provides instructions to copy the confluence install directory and home folder over, but makes no mention of install Java on the other server.

Can we please look into this and clarify.

Thanks,
Nick
fields.summary: Misleading Confluence Clustered Install Guide

fields.description:
The installer was made for a very specific use case that it was an evaluation method for trials of the software and not a way to deploy real instances.

The installer needs to state that it's an Evaluation installer in its filename and the first screen of text.
fields.summary: Brand the 2.8 Installer as an Evaluation Installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11540].
  {panel}

CONF-7409 was implemented for Confluence 2.8, allowing macros to use #requireResource (or WebResourceManager.requireResource()) to declare which CSS and JS resources they required when the page was built.

This functionality doesn't currently extend to including these resources in the following situations:

-preview in the editor: need to get the resources via AJAX from the server and include them in the page dynamically- (see CONF-11982)
- exports and notifications: use a hard-coded list of resources generated by /styles/combined.css?forWysiwyg=true
- rich-text editor (potentially): uses same hard-coded list as exports and notifications.

(The rich-text editor is less important because only Confluence macros typically render content that needs to be styled there. Most just appear as \{macro}...\{macro}.)
fields.summary: Resources requested by macros should be rendered in exports and notifications and other situations

fields.description:
Confluence allows users to create page names with '\-\-' in titles causing generated HTML comments to break in FireFox. Then when comments surround a block of code with a generated url, the ending tag shows up on the final page. Please see the screenshot. However, this is more than a display issue as some of the code in the comment can be also rendered or interpreted. For example, part of the following code will be interpreted and show the ending comment tag in FF: 

{code}
                            <!--
<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"
         xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"
         xmlns:trackback="http://madskills.com/public/xml/rss/module/trackback/">
<rdf:Description
    rdf:about="http://confluence/display/~theuser/This+--+Is+--+A+--+TEST%21%21"
    dc:identifier="http://confluence/display/~theuser/This+--+Is+--+A+--+TEST%21%21"
    dc:title="This -- Is -- A -- TEST!!"
    trackback:ping="http://confluence/rpc/trackback/21728198"/>

</rdf:RDF>
--> 
{code}
fields.summary: Bug in HTML comments can mininterpret and display raw tag in FF

fields.description:
If an update is performed on an old version of a page, then Confluence attempts to merge the changes.  If the changes cannot be merged by Confluence then it asks the user to do it. (Not too well, see [CONF-11529]). If this merge takes the user some time, and more changes are made in the meantime before the user saves again, the additional changes are lost, and no warning is given.

Suppose you have a page with lots of collaboration in a short time.  Eg a meeting minutes page.  The following steps cause data to be lost with no report.

# UserA starts editing the page.
# UserB starts editing the page.
# UserB adds a new line with some content to the end of the page and saves.  The change is committed.
# UserA adds a new line with some content to the end of the page and saves.  The change conflicts with UserB's change so he is given a merge page.
# UserC starts editing the page.
# UserC adds a new line with some content to the end of the page and saves.  The change is committed successfully. 
# UserA dutifully adds UserB's line into the editor before or after his own, and clicks Overwrite.  The change is committed successfully.  No merge with UserC's change is performed.

The end result is that despite UserA doing the right thing and properly merging the changes, UserC's changes are completely lost and nobody will ever know.  (Note, there don't really need to be 3 users, UserB could just make more changes while UserA is merging the first ones).

h3. Suggested fix.
Overwriting should be subject to another merge check for any changes made since the last merge was calculated.
fields.summary: Overwriting changes from the editing conflict screen also abandons any additional changes made after the conflict was detected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11529].
  {panel}

When a merge conflict occurs, the user is given a screen that contains:
* An error message
* A change report
* *Overwrite* and *Cancel* buttons
* An editor.

The error message says: 
{panel:bgColor=#fbb}
You were editing an outdated version of this page. Another user has updated this page before you. Your changes against the now updated version is shown below. Please decide whether your changes should overwrite it or you wish to discard your changes.
{panel}

What the user is actually expected to do if they're playing fair is:
* Look through the change report
* Merge any changes from the change report into their own submission in the editor
* Click Overwrite

Interestingly, the UI differs from [the documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Concurrent+Editing+and+Merging+Changes] so it has clearly changed at some stage in the past.  
It seems that some users don't realise they can update their entry with changes from the merge report before clicking Overwrite.  That doesn't seem too surprising to me given that the error message doesn't give "updating their changes" as an option let alone a suggestion.
fields.summary: The UI for merging changes after a page editing conflict is unclear

fields.description:
When inserting a new table row in the "Rich text" tab, there's a blank space in the beginning of the cell. If the user clicks into the cell to edit it, the space will be in the beginning of the text, so the cell content would be say " Description" instead of "Description"

Note that after saving, the space is removed, so it's not a very crucial bug, but it's annoying as the user might think he has to delete the space to get the text properly aligned.

Example (reproduced with nbsp):

||heading 1||heading 2|
|col A1| col A2|
|col B1|col B2|
fields.summary: Blank space inserted in new table rows

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Macros

Add documentation for the \{details} and \{detailssummary} macros.

These are part of the 'Tabular Metadata' macros installed by default with every Confluence instance.

They are not currently documented in the Notation Guide.

Description in the plugin repository is:
{quote}
Macros to store some details about pages, then display them in a tabular "master" view elsewhere
{quote}

When documentation is created, add them to the Confluence Hosted guide too:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CSH/Macros+and+Plugins+on+Confluence+Hosted

Have done some preliminary tested --- both macros demand a 'label=' parameter. The \{details} macro actually adds a label to a page.
fields.summary: Document the details and detailssummary macros
